New Records: Hungary endured a heavy 5-0 defeat by Germany, their worst in over a decade, and have a three-game losing streak. Bosnia and Herzegovina have lost seven consecutive games and 12 of their last 15 matches, struggling under new coach Sergej Barbarez and with a poor away record
Key Match Events: Hungary has an undefeated home record since September 2022 and has won two and drawn two of their previous four meetings against Bosnia and Herzegovina
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary are clear favorites heading into the match as home-side优势 and Bosnia and Herzegovina are facing a tough road environment after a series of losses
Miscellaneous Highlights: Betting tips include Hungary to win, over 2.5 goals, and both teams to score, with Hungary expected to dominate
Others: The match is part of the 2024-25 UEFA Nations League Group 3
